page.title: 17CATERHAM CARNIVAL
page.content: { CATERHAM CARNIVAL}is held annually with a fair. It was first held in 1957 and has been going ever since. The Carnival Committee aims to raise funds for various causes. In 1985 money was given to the{12th CATERHAM SCOUT GROUP to renovate their H.Q.; to{CATERHAM {S.C.C.}to buy equipment & canoes; the {ROTARY CLUB}of Caterham for repair and decoration of the{COMMUNITY CENTRE.} In 1985 there were 18 floats in the procession led by the Carnival Queen. The scout group made a 'ghost buster' float and there were a Viking Ship, an Egyptian float and a British Telecom float. Although it was exciting to watch one of the cubs said the best part of the Carnival was getting ready for it. In 1985 the{CATERHAM WIND BAND}played and in the arena guides gave displays of tent pitching & fire lighting.
